text: hello this is chef john from food
whooshes comm with one of my all-time
favorites corned beef hash with an egg
on top in fact I just make corned beef
just for the leftovers so you can take
some potatoes peel them quarter room and
boil them but not all the way you only
want to boil them for about 15 minutes
for that sighs we just want to cook the
starch a little bit but one I'm still
very firm because I'm going to take a
cleaver I'm going to chop them hash is
from the French hash a which means
chopped so you're going to hash shade
those up good and proper so keep at
Schoen till about that size not too
small because they're going to break up
a little bit in the pan I'm going to
take my corned beef I'm going to hash a
that firstyou hash a One Direction hash
a the other okay keep a shame until it's
very very thoroughly hash ade there you
go we're going to put it in our saute
pan there's no oil in there I'm going to
turn on medium heat and I'm just going
to let the natural fat from the beef
kind of render out a little bit there's
not going to be a ton so I'm going to
slowly cook that I'm going to add my
green onions chopped it's one bunch
mostly just the white parts alright
little salt and pepper be careful with
the salt because you know corned beef is
salty I'm going to add about a
tablespoon of butter and a little bit of
minced garlic and I'm going to cook that
on medium heat continuing on medium
pretty much medium heat this whole
process all right who's the butter melts
I'm going to add my potato hash a I'm
going to add my secret ingredient which
is two big spoons of roasted tomato
salsa does wonders for the flavor and
the color of this all right a little bit
of salt for the potatoes I'm going to
toss that and then the fun begins we
have to crust and make crusty our corned
beef hash what you want to do is you
want to mix it really well Pat it down
with a spatula and then about every five
minutes you want to flip it over so the
crustiness comes to the top and the
parts that aren't as crusty move to the
bottom and you want to keep building the
layers of crust
sometimes I'll kind of cut it in four
just so I can get my spatula under there
so just keep doing that cook turn
crossed cook turn crust and that is what
you're going for the amazing texture of
a properly crusted corned beef hash all
right when it's done I'm going to cut a
little piece off I'm going to put it on
my plate and I'm going to serve with the
traditional poached egg you can serve it
with any kind of egg you want a little
green onion on top the poached egg
though is the ultimate because check
this out you break it open and that warm
thick yolk drips into that crusty hash
it's really too good to describe so all
I'll say is and you can quote me on this
that is just it's surreal you have to
experience this so go buy a corned beef
boil it up make a couple sandwiches
whatever but then take that end piece
couple pound piece there chop it up and
taste the magic I hope you give that a
try
go to the site the ingredients are there
and as always enjoy
